name: file-devdata-mtdblock
description: The content of the file './etc/config/devdata' is '/dev/mtdblock/2', with no hardcoded credentials or sensitive information found. The file content points to an MTD block device, which may require further analysis to identify potential sensitive information.
notes: The file content points to an MTD block device, which may require further analysis of the device to identify potential sensitive information.

name: certificate-stunnel_cert-SHA1_weak_signature
notes: The certificate uses the SHA1 signature algorithm, which may pose security risks. It is recommended to upgrade to a more secure algorithm such as SHA256.

name: config-debug-level
description: The debug level in the stunnel.conf file is set to 7 (the highest level), which may lead to the exposure of sensitive information in log files. A high debug level could record encryption keys, certificate contents, or other sensitive operational details.
notes: It is recommended to lower the debug level to the production environment recommended value (typically 3 or lower) to reduce the risk of sensitive information leakage.

name: configuration-dynamic-MYDLINKMAIL
notes: Although no hardcoded sensitive information was found, it is recommended to verify the security of SMTP passwords stored in the device configuration.
